text.div:
• Include these codes as defined in http://dicom.nema.org/resources/ontology/DCM
    CodeDisplayDefinitionComments
    OPTENFOphthalmic Tomography En FaceNote: An acquisition device, process or method that creates en face tomography images of the eye based on light and optical principles. Tomography based on other principles, such as ultrasound, is excluded.
    OPTBSVOphthalmic Tomography B-scan Volume AnalysisNote: An acquisition device, process or method that performs B-scan volume analysis of tomography images of the eye based on light and optical principles. Tomography based on other principles, such as ultrasound, is excluded.
    OPVOphthalmic Visual FieldModality device that measures visual fields and perform visual perimetryNote: An acquisition device, process or method that measures visual fields and perform visual perimetry.
    DXDigital RadiographyDigital Radiography deviceNote: An acquisition device, process or method that performs digital radiography.
    OPTOphthalmic TomographyTomography of the eye acquired by a modality that is based on light and optical principles. Tomography based on other principles, such as ultrasound, is excludedNote: An acquisition device, process or method that performs tomography of the eye that is based on light and optical principles. Tomography based on other principles, such as ultrasound, is excluded.
    BMDBone Mineral DensitometryBone Mineral Densitometry by X-Ray (modality), including dual-energy X-Ray absorptiometry (DXA) and morphometric X-Ray absorptiometry (MXA)Note: An acquisition device, process or method that performs bone mineral densitometry by X-Ray, including dual-energy X-Ray absorptiometry (DXA) and morphometric X-Ray absorptiometry (MXA).
    MGMammographyMammography deviceNote: An acquisition device, process or method that performs mammography.
    SMSlide MicroscopySlide MicroscopyNote: An acquisition device, process or method that performs slide microscopy.
    USUltrasoundUltrasound deviceNote: An acquisition device, process or method that performs ultrasound.
    OPOphthalmic PhotographyOphthalmic photography modalityNote: An acquisition device, process or method that performs ophthalmic photography.
    IVOCTIntravascular Optical Coherence TomographyAn acquisition device, process or method that performs intravascular optical coherence tomographyNote: An acquisition device, process or method that performs intravascular optical coherence tomography.
    MRMagnetic ResonanceMagnetic Resonance deviceNote: An acquisition device, process or method that performs magnetic resonance imaging.
    ECGElectrocardiographyElectrocardiography deviceNote: An acquisition device, process or method that performs magnetic resonance imaging.
    GMGeneral MicroscopyGeneral Microscopy deviceNote: An acquisition device, process or method that performs electrocardiography.
    IOIntra-oral RadiographyIntra-oral Radiography deviceNote: An acquisition device, process or method that performs intra-oral radiography.
    XAX-Ray AngiographyX-Ray Angiography deviceNote: An acquisition device, process or method that performs X-Ray angiography.
    XCExternal-camera PhotographyExternal-camera Photography deviceNote: An acquisition device, process or method that performs photography with an external camera.
    VAVisual AcuityVisual Acuity deviceNote: An acquisition device, process or method that measures visual acuity.
    IVUSIntravascular UltrasoundIntravascular Ultrasound deviceNote: An acquisition device, process or method that performs intravascular ultrasound.
    CRComputed RadiographyComputed Radiography deviceNote: An acquisition device, process or method that performs computed radiography.
    ESEndoscopyEndoscopy deviceNote: An acquisition device, process or method that records images during endoscopy.
    ARAutorefractionAutorefraction deviceNote: An acquisition device, process or method that measures autorefraction.
    CTComputed TomographyComputed Tomography deviceNote: An acquisition device, process or method that performs computed tomography.
    OSSOptical Surface ScannerAn acquisition device, process or method that performs optical surface scanningNote: An acquisition device, process or method that performs optical surface scanning.
    LENLensometryLensometry deviceNote: An acquisition device, process or method that performs lensometry.
    RGRadiographic imagingRadiographic imaging (conventional film/screen)Note: An acquisition device, process or method that performs radiographic imaging (conventional film/screen).
    RFRadiofluoroscopyRadiofluoroscopy deviceNote: An acquisition device, process or method that performs radiofluoroscopy.
    KERKeratometryKeratometry deviceNote: An acquisition device, process or method that performs keratometry.
    HDHemodynamic WaveformHemodynamic Waveform acquisition deviceNote: An acquisition device, process or method that records hemodynamic waveforms.
    OAMOphthalmic Axial MeasurementsMeasurements of the axial length of the eye, which are done by various devicesNote: An acquisition device, process or method that measures the axial length of the eye.
    NMNuclear MedicineNuclear Medicine deviceNote: An acquisition device, process or method that performs nuclear medicine imaging.
    OCTOptical Coherence TomographyModality device that uses an interferometric, non-invasive optical tomographic technique to image 2D slices and 3D volumes of tissue using visible and near visible frequenciesNote: An acquisition device, process or method that uses an interferometric, non-invasive optical tomographic technique to image 2D slices and 3D volumes of tissue using visible and near visible frequencies.
    BDUSUltrasound Bone DensitometryUltrasound Bone Densitometry (modality)Note: An acquisition device, process or method that performs ultrasound bone densitometry.
    PTPositron emission tomographyPositron emission tomography (PET) deviceNote: An acquisition device, process or method that performs positron emission tomography (PET).
    EPSCardiac ElectrophysiologyCardiac Electrophysiology deviceNote: An acquisition device, process or method that performs cardiac electrophysiology.
    PXPanoramic X-RayPanoramic X-Ray deviceNote: An acquisition device, process or method that performs panoramic X-Rays.
    SRFSubjective RefractionSubjective Refraction deviceNote: An acquisition device, process or method that records subjective refraction.
    OPMOphthalmic MappingModality device that measures corneal topography, corneal or retinal thickness, and other similar parameters that are typically displayed as mapsNote: An acquisition device, process or method that measures corneal topography, corneal or retinal thickness, and other similar parameters that are typically displayed as maps.
    OPROphthalmic RefractionModality device that measures the refractive characteristics of the eyeNote: An acquisition device, process or method that measures the refractive characteristics of the eye.

Additional Language Displays

extension.valueString: An acquisition device, process or method that creates en face tomography images of the eye based on light and optical principles. Tomography based on other principles, such as ultrasound, is excluded.

An acquisition device, process or method that performs B-scan volume analysis of tomography images of the eye based on light and optical principles. Tomography based on other principles, such as ultrasound, is excluded.

designation.value: Analyse du volume de la tomographie ophtalmique B-scan
Analisi del volume della scansione B della tomografia oftalmica
